Fine quality Fulani strip weave woollen kaasa blanket from Mali, first half of C20th. Creamy white ground with particularly elaborate natural dyed wool motifs. These beautiful cloths were the quintessential designs of the southern fringe of the Sahara and were much sought after across West Africa. We find occasional  examples like this, with a softer feel than the more scratchy recent pieces,  mainly in Ghana where they have been traded for centuries.  Condition is slightly worn in places. Measures 88 inches x 53, 225 cms x 134. Price Â£475/US$640/â‚¬585 including FedEx shipping. Prelate of the Methodist Church Nigeria, Dr. Samuel Chukwuemeka Uche, has insisted that those who kidnapped him three weeks ago were F.ulani, contrary to intelligence reports that the prime suspect hails from his village.

The cleric, who faulted investigations that the offender was a native that had reportedly been arrested at a bank, where he allegedly wanted to lodge his roughly â‚¦20 million share of the ransom, also dismissed the conspiratorial theory of an insiderâ€™s job.

Uche told The Guardian that his abductors were F.ulani, who claimed to be from Sudan, Mali and Niger. Asked if actually the police have arrested any suspect in connection with his abduction, the prelate said: â€œI donâ€™t know. The police should know that. What I know is that all the people within our area went to the bush to fish out the culprits. I donâ€™t know if any of my people was involved. The person they alleged that hails from my village is from another area in Abia State, I am not from Abia. I am from Imo State.â€

He went further to tell The Guardian that: â€œI am not a small boy. I am almost 70 years; I canâ€™t tell you what I donâ€™t know. Those who took me to the bush are all F.ulani. Government is trying to cover up, but they cannot cover up because I have exposed them to the international community. They are uncomfortable with the truth that I said. What I said was the whole truth, and nothing but the truth. Where I was kidnapped is not my village.â€

The priest continued: â€œI donâ€™t think it is an insiderâ€™s job. I didnâ€™t see any ÃŒgbÃ² man among the kidnappers. They are all F.ulani boys. In fact, some of them said they are from Sudan, some said they are from Mali, some said they are from Niger and they were eight in number. That is what I know.â€

He was kidnapped three weeks ago in Abia State along with two others â€“ the Bishop of Owerri Diocese and the prelateâ€™s chaplain.

According to Uche, the Methodist Church paid â‚¦100 million in ransom to secure their release.

Â«Â Avec Buubu Ardo Galo, Gelaajo Hambodeejo constitue une figure passerelle entre lâ€™ordre ancien dominÃ© par le ArBe et lâ€™ordre nouveau, islamique, bÃ¢ti par SÃ©kou Ahmadou Lobbo, Ã  partir de 1818. Mais alors que Buubu Ardo Galo meurt en luttant contre cet ordre nouveau, Gelaajo Hambodeejo le conteste et lui survit, laissant des traces plus de 30 ans aprÃ¨s lâ€™Ã©tablissement du Â« laamu Diina Â», mais bien loin de son Kunaari natal.Â 

Gelaajo se distingue par sa bravoure, son sens politique, mais aussi par sa gÃ©nÃ©rositÃ© lÃ©gendaire, qui avait fait de lui une figure populaire de son vivant.Â Â»
